dillon.gameAPI.networking

Class NetworkConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • dillon.gameAPI.networking.NetworkConnection

  • public class NetworkConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    This handles a connection to a server, from client to server.
    Author:
    Dillon - Github dg092099

      • connect

        public static void connect(java.lang.String host,
                           int port,
                           SecurityKey k)
                    throws NetworkingError
        Tells the engine to connect to a server.
        Parameters:
        host - The ip address of the server.
        port - The port number of the server.
        k - The security key.
        Throws:
        NetworkingError - Problems connecting

      • connect

        public static void connect(java.net.InetSocketAddress add,
                           SecurityKey k)
                    throws NetworkingError
        Connects to a server, using the Inet socket address.
        Parameters:
        add - The socket address.
        k - The security key
        Throws:
        NetworkingError - If connecting fails.

      • discoverServers

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.net.InetSocketAddress> discoverServers(java.lang.String gameName,
                                                                              java.lang.String version,
                                                                              java.lang.String code)
        Finds all of the servers using the given information.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The game's name.
        version - The game's version.
        code - If there's a code, the code. If there is no code, use null.
        Returns:
        An array list of InetSocketAddresses with all of the servers that responded.

      • disconnect

        public static void disconnect(SecurityKey k)
        Tries to disconnect from the server. Automatically executes on game shutdown.
        Parameters:
        k - The security key.

      • getRunning

        public static boolean getRunning()
        Returns if the connection is alive.
        Returns:
        alive.

        Sends a message to the server.
